freenet.crypt
Class PCFBMode

java.lang.Object
  freenet.crypt.PCFBMode
Direct Known Subclasses:
RijndaelPCFBMode
public class PCFBMode
extends Object

Control mechanism for the Periodic Cipher Feed Back mode. This is a CFB variant used apparently by a number of programs, including PGP. Thanks to Hal for suggesting it. http://www.streamsec.com/pcfb1.pdf NOTE: This is identical to CFB if block size = key size. As of Freenet 0.7, we use it with block size = key size.

Author:
Scott

Resets the PCFBMode to an initial IV

Parameters:
iv - The buffer containing the IV.
offset - The offset to start reading the IV at.

writeIV

public void writeIV(RandomSource rs,
                    OutputStream out)
             throws IOException
Writes the initialization vector to the stream. Though the IV is transmitted in the clear, this gives the attacker no additional information because the registerPointer is set so that the encrypted buffer is empty. This causes an immediate encryption of the IV, thus invalidating any information that the attacker had.

Throws:
IOException

readIV

public void readIV(InputStream in)
            throws IOException
Reads the initialization vector from the given stream.

Throws:
IOException

lengthIV

public int lengthIV()
returns the length of the IV

decipher

public int decipher(int b)
Deciphers one byte of data, by XOR'ing the ciphertext byte with one byte from the encrypted buffer. Then places the received byte in the feedback register. If no bytes are available in the encrypted buffer, the feedback register is encrypted, providing block_size/8 new bytes for decryption

blockDecipher

public byte[] blockDecipher(byte[] buf,
                            int off,
                            int len)
NOTE: As a side effect, this will decrypt the data in the array.

encipher

public int encipher(int b)
Enciphers one byte of data, by XOR'ing the plaintext byte with one byte from the encrypted buffer. Then places the enciphered byte in the feedback register. If no bytes are available in the encrypted buffer, the feedback register is encrypted, providing block_size/8 new bytes for encryption

blockEncipher

public byte[] blockEncipher(byte[] buf,
                            int off,
                            int len)
NOTE: As a sideeffect, this will encrypt the data in the array.
